text: Frederick Edwin Siefke (March 27, 1870 - April 18, 1893) was an American Major League Baseball player from New York City. ==Career== Siefke's only season consisted of 16 games at third base for the 1890 Brooklyn Gladiators during their one and only season in the American Association. In 58 at bats, he collected eight hits for a .138 batting average that included two doubles and one run scored. ==Post-career== Siefke died at the age of 23 of Bright's disease in New York City, and is buried in Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn, New York. ==References== ==External links== Category:1870 births Category:1893 deaths Category:19th-century baseball players Category:Baseball players from New York (state) Category:Major League Baseball third basemen Category:Brooklyn Gladiators players Category:Burials at Green-Wood Cemetery Category:Sportspeople from New York City Category:Deaths from kidney disease Category:Lynn (minor league baseball) players
title: Fred Siefke
